comment: i already wrote a review, but i just have to write another one to say this: Dr. Okie is late to everything, yet has the audacity to emphasize punctuality. This guy is a joke.
Nice guy, but very disorganized. Also, a very tough grader. His instructions are not very clear, and he will take points off for not being able to read his mind with what he wants essentially.

Do not suggest this guy AT ALL! He is very knowledgeable on how to teach but nothing is organized. It is impossible to work ahead on big projects as he changes up every assignment last minute and gave the rubric on the day before, combined with assigning WAY too much compared to the other professors who teach the same class. STAY AWAY!

Took Okie's online Historical Methods section last fall, absolutely loved it. A truly competent and knowledgeable professor that helps you succeed while still challenging you. Super well-organized class, offered tons of insight into the field and how we might find ourselves in it. Great guy, would take again.

Taken during COVID, Dr. Okie's class wasn't the best. Assignments weren't overly difficult, but he nitpicks everything! About half of the class was spent on a project with a lesson plan produced at the end, but we didn't spend much time working on how to make them. Also, he tends to be unstructured, indirect, and rude. Not unbearable but not fun.

Best professor ever. If I get the chance to take another one of his classes I absolutely will. The class is a lot of work, but Professor Okie makes it bearable and gives great direction with clear expectations.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I added this class last minute and I am SO glad I did. I took it online over the summer and I was totally impressed and satisfied with the course. No tests. A midterm essay and a final essay. Dr. Okie is EXTREMELY knowledgeable, caring, and helpful. His feedback is clear and he responds quickly. I'm sure he is the best professor at KSU. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Okie was one of the best professors I have had at Kennesaw thus far. Before his class, I had never received above a B in history, and he made history so fun. His class was very well organized, and he always provided a checklist at the beginning of modules that let us know what was due when. If you get the chance to take him, you should!

really nice guy. attendance is 10% of grade. 0 tests, midterm and final are both essays but they're not very hard. graded off 3 reading response essays (only 350-500 words) based on 1 assigned chapter each from the text book but its not too hard and a few in class assignments. I would take him again
